slides.title: Welcome to Professional Ethics
slides.content:
# Global Professional Ethics

The **foundation of professional trust**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Principles** - Fundamental ethics
- **Independence** - Auditor rules
- **Threats** - Risk assessment
- **Decisions** - Ethical framework

## Structure

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| IESBA Code | Global standard |
| Independence | Audit context |
| Conflicts | Resolution |
| Whistleblowing | Reporting |

slides.title: Fundamental Principles
slides.content:
# IESBA Code

## Five Principles

| Principle | Meaning |
|-----------|--------|
| Integrity | Straightforward, honest |
| Objectivity | Unbiased judgment |
| Professional competence | Due care |
| Confidentiality | Protect information |
| Professional behavior | Comply with laws |

## Application

```
Apply in all circumstances:
- Client work
- Employment
- Business relationships
```

slides.title: Threats and Safeguards
slides.content:
# Conceptual Framework

## Threat Categories

| Threat | Source |
|--------|--------|
| Self-interest | Financial interest |
| Self-review | Own work |
| Advocacy | Client promotion |
| Familiarity | Close relationship |
| Intimidation | Pressure |

## Framework Approach

```
1. Identify threats
2. Evaluate significance
3. Apply safeguards
4. If unacceptable: Decline/remove
```

slides.title: Independence
slides.content:
# Auditor Independence

## Types

| Type | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| In mind | Actual state |
| In appearance | Perceived by others |

## Requirements

| Relationship | Rule |
|--------------|------|
| Financial interest | Prohibited |
| Family employment | Restricted |
| Loans | Prohibited |
| Business relationships | Restricted |

## Period

```
Engagement period:
Start of engagement to opinion date
Plus period covered by statements
```

slides.title: Non-Assurance Services
slides.content:
# Services to Audit Clients

## Prohibited Services

| Service | Why |
|---------|-----|
| Bookkeeping | Self-review |
| Valuations | Material amounts |
| Internal audit | Management role |
| Legal | Advocacy |
| Recruitment | Familiarity |

## Safeguards

| Safeguard | Application |
|-----------|-------------|
| Separate team | Different people |
| Review | Independent |
| Pre-approval | By audit committee |

slides.title: Fees and Gifts
slides.content:
# Financial Relationships

## Fee Issues

| Issue | Threat |
|-------|--------|
| Contingent fees | Self-interest |
| Low balling | Quality |
| Overdue fees | Self-interest |
| Fee dependency | Self-interest |

## Gifts and Hospitality

```
Acceptable if:
- Trivial value
- Inconsequential
- No intent to influence
```

## Fee Dependency

```
> 15% from one client = Threat
Safeguard: External review
```

slides.title: Conflicts of Interest
slides.content:
# Managing Conflicts

## Types

| Conflict | Example |
|----------|--------|
| Between clients | Competitors |
| Accountant vs client | Personal interest |
| Multiple hats | Different roles |

## Resolution Process

```
1. Identify the conflict
2. Evaluate significance
3. Assess whether:
   - Can continue with safeguards
   - Must decline one or both
4. Document decision
```

## Safeguards

- Information barriers
- Separate teams
- Confidentiality agreements
- Disclosure and consent

slides.title: Confidentiality
slides.content:
# Protecting Information

## Obligation

```
Do not disclose without:
- Proper authority
- Legal duty
- Professional right
```

## Exceptions

| Exception | Example |
|-----------|--------|
| Legal requirement | Court order |
| Professional duty | Audit opinion |
| Authorization | Client consent |
| Public interest | Fraud report |

## After Engagement

```
Obligation continues after
end of client relationship
```

slides.title: Responding to NOCLAR
slides.content:
# Non-Compliance with Laws

## NOCLAR Framework

```
Non-Compliance with Laws
and Regulations
```

## Steps

| Step | Action |
|------|--------|
| 1 | Obtain understanding |
| 2 | Discuss with management |
| 3 | Consider significance |
| 4 | Determine response |

## Public Interest

```
May override confidentiality
if in the public interest
to disclose
```

slides.title: Ethical Decision Making
slides.content:
# Decision Framework

## Steps

```
1. Identify the issue
2. Gather facts
3. Consider ethical principles
4. Identify alternatives
5. Consider consequences
6. Make decision
7. Implement and monitor
```

## Considerations

| Factor | Question |
|--------|----------|
| Legal | Is it lawful? |
| Professional | Standards compliant? |
| Personal | Comfortable? |
| Public | Withstand scrutiny? |

slides.title: Whistleblowing
slides.content:
# Reporting Wrongdoing

## When to Consider

| Situation | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| Internal ignored | Escalate |
| Serious harm | Report |
| Legal requirement | Must report |

## Protections

| Protection | Scope |
|------------|-------|
| Legal | Some jurisdictions |
| Professional | Body support |
| Employer | Policy-based |

## Process

```
1. Internal first
2. If no action: Regulator
3. Document everything
```

slides.title: Professional Skepticism
slides.content:
# Critical Mindset

## Definition

```
An attitude that includes:
- Questioning mind
- Alert to inconsistencies
- Critical assessment of evidence
```

## Application

| Area | Skepticism |
|------|------------|
| Representations | Verify |
| Documents | Authenticity |
| Estimates | Challenge |
| Explanations | Corroborate |

## Not the Same As

- Distrust
- Suspicion
- Finding fraud
